00033 /**
00034  * \file
00035  *         Device drivers header file for adxl345 accelerometer in Zolertia Z1.
00036  * \author
00037  *         Marcus Lund√©n, SICS <mlunden@sics.se>
00038  *         Enric Calvo, Zolertia <ecalvo@zolertia.com>
00039  */
00040 
00041 #ifndef __ADXL345_H__
00042 #define __ADXL345_H__
00043 #include <stdio.h>
00044 #include "i2cmaster.h"
00045 
00046 #define DEBUGLEDS 0
00047 #if DEBUGLEDS
00048   #undef LEDS_ON(x)
00049   #undef LEDS_OFF(x)
00050   #define LEDS_ON(x)    (LEDS_PxOUT &= ~x)
00051   #define LEDS_OFF(x)   (LEDS_PxOUT |= x)
00052 #else
00053   #undef LEDS_ON
00054   #undef LEDS_OFF
00055   #define LEDS_ON(x)
00056   #define LEDS_OFF(x)
00057 #endif
00058 
00059 #define LEDS_R        0x10
00060 #define LEDS_G        0x40
00061 #define LEDS_B        0x20
00062 #define L_ON(x)    (LEDS_PxOUT &= ~x)
00063 #define L_OFF(x)   (LEDS_PxOUT |= x)
00064 
00065 //XXX Temporary place for defines that are lacking in mspgcc4's gpio.h
00066 #ifdef __GNUC__
00067 #ifndef P1SEL2_
00068   #define P1SEL2_             0x0041  /* Port 1 Selection 2*/
00069   sfrb(P1SEL2, P1SEL2_);
00070 #endif
00071 #endif
00072 #ifdef __IAR_SYSTEMS_ICC__
00073 #ifndef P1SEL2_
00074 #define P1SEL2_              (0x0041u)  /* Port 1 Selection 2*/
00075 DEFC(   P1SEL2             , P1SEL2_)
00076 #endif
00077 #endif
00078 
00079 
00080 /* Used in accm_read_axis(), eg accm_read_axis(X_AXIS);*/
00081 enum ADXL345_AXIS {
00082   X_AXIS = 0,
00083   Y_AXIS = 2,
00084   Z_AXIS = 4,
00085 };
00086 
00087 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00088 /* Init the accelerometer: ports, pins, registers, interrupts (none enabled), I2C,
00089     default threshold values etc. */
00090 void    accm_init(void);
00091 
00092 /* Write to a register.
00093     args:
00094       reg       register to write to
00095       val       value to write
00096 */
00097 void    accm_write_reg(u8_t reg, u8_t val);
00098 
00099 /* Write several registers from a stream.
00100     args:
00101       len       number of bytes to read
00102       data      pointer to where the data is read from
00103   First byte in stream must be the register address to begin writing to.
00104   The data is then written from the second byte and increasing. The address byte
00105   is not included in length len. */
00106 void    accm_write_stream(u8_t len, u8_t *data);
00107 
00108 /* Read one register.
00109     args:
00110       reg       what register to read
00111     returns the value of the read register
00112 */
00113 u8_t    accm_read_reg(u8_t reg);
00114 
00115 /* Read several registers in a stream.
00116     args:
00117       reg       what register to start reading from
00118       len       number of bytes to read
00119       whereto   pointer to where the data is saved
00120 */
00121 void    accm_read_stream(u8_t reg, u8_t len, u8_t *whereto);
00122 
00123 /* Read an axis of the accelerometer (x, y or z). Return value is a signed 10 bit int.
00124   The resolution of the acceleration measurement can be increased up to 13 bit, but
00125   will change the data format of this read out. Refer to the data sheet if so is
00126   wanted/needed. */
00127 int16_t accm_read_axis(enum ADXL345_AXIS axis);
00128 
00129 /* Sets the g-range, ie the range the accelerometer measures (ie 2g means -2 to +2 g
00130     on every axis). Possible values:
00131         ADXL345_RANGE_2G
00132         ADXL345_RANGE_4G
00133         ADXL345_RANGE_8G
00134         ADXL345_RANGE_16G
00135     Example:
00136         accm_set_grange(ADXL345_RANGE_4G);
00137     */
00138 void    accm_set_grange(u8_t grange);
00139 
00140 /* Map interrupt (FF, tap, dbltap etc) to interrupt pin (IRQ_INT1, IRQ_INT2).
00141     This must come after accm_init() as the registers will otherwise be overwritten. */
00142 void    accm_set_irq(uint8_t int1, uint8_t int2);
00143 
00144 /* Macros for setting the pointers to callback functions from the interrupts.
00145   The function will be called with an u8_t as parameter, containing the interrupt
00146   flag register from the ADXL345. That way, several interrupts can be mapped to
00147   the same pin and be read from the  */
00148 #define ACCM_REGISTER_INT1_CB(ptr)   accm_int1_cb = ptr;
00149 #define ACCM_REGISTER_INT2_CB(ptr)   accm_int2_cb = ptr;
00150 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00151 /* Application definitions, change if required by application. */
00152 
00153 /* Interrupt suppress periods */
00154 /*
00155 // XXX Not used yet.
00156 #define ADXL345_INT_OVERRUN_BACKOFF     CLOCK_SECOND/8
00157 #define ADXL345_INT_WATERMARK_BACKOFF   CLOCK_SECOND/8
00158 #define ADXL345_INT_FREEFALL_BACKOFF    CLOCK_SECOND/8
00159 #define ADXL345_INT_INACTIVITY_BACKOFF  CLOCK_SECOND/8
00160 #define ADXL345_INT_ACTIVITY_BACKOFF    CLOCK_SECOND/8
00161 #define ADXL345_INT_DOUBLETAP_BACKOFF   CLOCK_SECOND/8
00162 #define ADXL345_INT_TAP_BACKOFF         CLOCK_SECOND/8
00163 #define ADXL345_INT_DATAREADY_BACKOFF   CLOCK_SECOND/8
00164 */
00165 /* Time after an interrupt that subsequent interrupts are suppressed. Should later
00166   be turned into one specific time per type of interrupt (tap, freefall etc) */
00167 #define SUPPRESS_TIME_INT1    CLOCK_SECOND/4
00168 #define SUPPRESS_TIME_INT2    CLOCK_SECOND/4
00169 
00170 /* Suggested defaults according to the data sheet etc */
00171 #define ADXL345_THRESH_TAP_DEFAULT      0x48    // 4.5g (0x30 == 3.0g) (datasheet: 3g++)
00172 #define ADXL345_OFSX_DEFAULT            0x00    // for individual units calibration purposes
00173 #define ADXL345_OFSY_DEFAULT            0x00
00174 #define ADXL345_OFSZ_DEFAULT            0x00
00175 #define ADXL345_DUR_DEFAULT             0x20    // 20 ms (datasheet: 10ms++)
00176 #define ADXL345_LATENT_DEFAULT          0x50    // 100 ms (datasheet: 20ms++)
00177 #define ADXL345_WINDOW_DEFAULT          0xFF    // 320 ms (datasheet: 80ms++)
00178 #define ADXL345_THRESH_ACT_DEFAULT      0x15    // 1.3g (62.5 mg/LSB)
00179 #define ADXL345_THRESH_INACT_DEFAULT    0x08    // 0.5g (62.5 mg/LSB)
00180 #define ADXL345_TIME_INACT_DEFAULT      0x02    // 2 s (1 s/LSB)
00181 #define ADXL345_ACT_INACT_CTL_DEFAULT   0xFF    // all axis involved, ac-coupled
00182 #define ADXL345_THRESH_FF_DEFAULT       0x09    // 563 mg
00183 #define ADXL345_TIME_FF_DEFAULT         0x20    // 160 ms
00184 #define ADXL345_TAP_AXES_DEFAULT        0x07    // all axis, no suppression
00185 
00186 #define ADXL345_BW_RATE_DEFAULT         (0x00|ADXL345_SRATE_100)   // 100 Hz, normal operation
00187 #define ADXL345_POWER_CTL_DEFAULT       0x28      // link bit set, no autosleep, start normal measuring
00188 #define ADXL345_INT_ENABLE_DEFAULT      0x00    // no interrupts enabled
00189 #define ADXL345_INT_MAP_DEFAULT         0x00    // all mapped to int_1
00190 
00191 /* XXX NB: In the data format register, data format of axis readings is chosen
00192   between left or right justify. This affects the position of the MSB/LSB and is
00193   different depending on g-range and resolution. If changed, make sure this is
00194   reflected in the _read_axis() function. Also, the resolution can be increased
00195   from 10 bit to at most 13 bit, but this also changes position of MSB etc on data
00196   format so check this in read_axis() too. */
00197 #define ADXL345_DATA_FORMAT_DEFAULT     (0x00|ADXL345_RANGE_2G)    // right-justify, 2g, 10-bit mode, int is active high
00198 #define ADXL345_FIFO_CTL_DEFAULT        0x00    // FIFO bypass mode
00199 
00200 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00201 /* Reference definitions, should not be changed */
00202 /* adxl345 slave address */
00203 #define ADXL345_ADDR            0x53
00204 
00205 /* ADXL345 registers */
00206 #define ADXL345_DEVID           0x00    // read only
00207 /* registers 0x01 to 0x1C are reserved, do not access */
00208 #define ADXL345_THRESH_TAP      0x1D
00209 #define ADXL345_OFSX            0x1E
00210 #define ADXL345_OFSY            0x1F
00211 #define ADXL345_OFSZ            0x20
00212 #define ADXL345_DUR             0x21
00213 #define ADXL345_LATENT          0x22
00214 #define ADXL345_WINDOW          0x23
00215 #define ADXL345_THRESH_ACT      0x24
00216 #define ADXL345_THRESH_INACT    0x25
00217 #define ADXL345_TIME_INACT      0x26
00218 #define ADXL345_ACT_INACT_CTL   0x27
00219 #define ADXL345_THRESH_FF       0x28
00220 #define ADXL345_TIME_FF         0x29
00221 #define ADXL345_TAP_AXES        0x2A
00222 #define ADXL345_ACT_TAP_STATUS  0x2B    // read only
00223 #define ADXL345_BW_RATE         0x2C
00224 #define ADXL345_POWER_CTL       0x2D
00225 #define ADXL345_INT_ENABLE      0x2E
00226 #define ADXL345_INT_MAP         0x2F
00227 #define ADXL345_INT_SOURCE      0x30    // read only
00228 #define ADXL345_DATA_FORMAT     0x31
00229 #define ADXL345_DATAX0          0x32    // read only, LSByte X, two's complement
00230 #define ADXL345_DATAX1          0x33    // read only, MSByte X
00231 #define ADXL345_DATAY0          0x34    // read only, LSByte Y
00232 #define ADXL345_DATAY1          0x35    // read only, MSByte X
00233 #define ADXL345_DATAZ0          0x36    // read only, LSByte Z
00234 #define ADXL345_DATAZ1          0x37    // read only, MSByte X
00235 #define ADXL345_FIFO_CTL        0x38
00236 #define ADXL345_FIFO_STATUS     0x39    // read only
00237 
00238 /* ADXL345 interrupts */
00239 #define ADXL345_INT_DISABLE     0X00    // used for disabling interrupts
00240 #define ADXL345_INT_OVERRUN     0X01
00241 #define ADXL345_INT_WATERMARK   0X02
00242 #define ADXL345_INT_FREEFALL    0X04
00243 #define ADXL345_INT_INACTIVITY  0X08
00244 #define ADXL345_INT_ACTIVITY    0X10
00245 #define ADXL345_INT_DOUBLETAP   0X20
00246 #define ADXL345_INT_TAP         0X40
00247 #define ADXL345_INT_DATAREADY   0X80
00248 
00249 /* Accelerometer hardware ports, pins and registers on the msp430 ¬µC */
00250 #define ADXL345_DIR        P1DIR
00251 #define ADXL345_PIN        P1PIN
00252 #define ADXL345_REN        P1REN
00253 #define ADXL345_SEL        P1SEL
00254 #define ADXL345_SEL2       P1SEL2
00255 #define ADXL345_INT1_PIN   (1<<6)            // P1.6
00256 #define ADXL345_INT2_PIN   (1<<7)            // P1.7
00257 #define ADXL345_IES        P1IES
00258 #define ADXL345_IE         P1IE
00259 #define ADXL345_IFG        P1IFG
00260 #define ADXL345_VECTOR     PORT1_VECTOR
00261 
00262 /* g-range for DATA_FORMAT register */
00263 #define ADXL345_RANGE_2G    0x00
00264 #define ADXL345_RANGE_4G    0x01
00265 #define ADXL345_RANGE_8G    0x02
00266 #define ADXL345_RANGE_16G   0x03
00267 
00268 
00269 /* The adxl345 has programmable sample rates, but unexpected results may occur if the wrong 
00270   rate and I2C bus speed is used (see datasheet p 17). Sample rates in Hz. This
00271   setting does not change the internal sampling rate, just how often it is piped
00272   to the output registers (ie the interrupt features use the full sample rate
00273   internally).
00274 
00275   Example use:
00276     adxl345_set_reg(ADXL345_BW_RATE, ((_ADXL345_STATUS & LOW_POWER) | ADXL345_SRATE_50));
00277   */
00278 #define ADXL345_SRATE_3200      0x0F    // XXX NB don't use at all as I2C data rate<= 400kHz (see datasheet)
00279 #define ADXL345_SRATE_1600      0x0E    // XXX NB don't use at all as I2C data rate<= 400kHz (see datasheet)
00280 #define ADXL345_SRATE_800       0x0D    // when I2C data rate == 400 kHz
00281 #define ADXL345_SRATE_400       0x0C    // when I2C data rate == 400 kHz
00282 #define ADXL345_SRATE_200       0x0B    // when I2C data rate >= 100 kHz
00283 #define ADXL345_SRATE_100       0x0A    // when I2C data rate >= 100 kHz
00284 #define ADXL345_SRATE_50        0x09    // when I2C data rate >= 100 kHz
00285 #define ADXL345_SRATE_25        0x08    // when I2C data rate >= 100 kHz
00286 #define ADXL345_SRATE_12_5      0x07    // 12.5 Hz, when I2C data rate >= 100 kHz
00287 #define ADXL345_SRATE_6_25      0x06    // when I2C data rate >= 100 kHz
00288 #define ADXL345_SRATE_3_13      0x05    // when I2C data rate >= 100 kHz
00289 #define ADXL345_SRATE_1_56      0x04    // when I2C data rate >= 100 kHz
00290 #define ADXL345_SRATE_0_78      0x03    // when I2C data rate >= 100 kHz
00291 #define ADXL345_SRATE_0_39      0x02    // when I2C data rate >= 100 kHz
00292 #define ADXL345_SRATE_0_20      0x01    // when I2C data rate >= 100 kHz
00293 #define ADXL345_SRATE_0_10      0x00    // 0.10 Hz, when I2C data rate >= 100 kHz
00294 
00295 /* Callback pointers for the interrupts */
00296 void (*accm_int1_cb)(u8_t reg);
00297 void (*accm_int2_cb)(u8_t reg);
00298 
00299 /* Interrupt 1 and 2 events; ADXL345 signals interrupt on INT1 or INT2 pins,
00300   ISR is invoked and polls the accelerometer process which invokes the callbacks. */
00301 process_event_t int1_event, int2_event;   // static ?
00302 
00303 #define ACCM_INT1    0x01
00304 #define ACCM_INT2    0x02
00305

00307 /* -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
00308 #endif /* ifndef __ADXL345_H__ */
